class AlarmSystem { constructor(weather) { this.weather = weather; this.windowOpen = false; } checkSystem() { if (this.weather === 'rainy' && this.windowOpen) { console.log('Window should be closed to prevent water damage.'); } else if (this.weather !== 'rainy' && this.windowOpen) { console.log('Window can stay open.'); } else { console.log('System check complete, no action needed.'); } } toggleWindow(state) { this.windowOpen = state; console.log('Window state changed.'); } } const system = new AlarmSystem('sunny'); system.toggleWindow(true); system.checkSystem();",

If the system suggests closing the window, can it be inferred that the weather is rainy?
Explanation: This scenario tests the inference from effect (system suggests closing the window) to cause (weather being rainy) without intervention. The suggestion to close the window comes only if the weather is rainy AND the window is open. However, without information on the window's state (whether it is actually open or not), it cannot be definitively concluded that the weather must be rainy; the window might be closed independently of the weather's condition.
